thread.title: ‘Isle of Dogs’ Review: Wes Anderson Unleashed

author: Joe Morgenstern
title: ‘Isle of Dogs’ Review: Wes Anderson Unleashed
text: When we were kids we didn’t know or care how movies were made. They were magical entities unto themselves, and we watched them rapt. Recapturing that state of mind, eye and heart is certainly hard, but not impossible, as “Isle of Dogs” shows. Wes Anderson’s joyous stop-motion feature looks and sounds like nothing we’ve encountered before, including his previous stop-motion feature, “Fantastic Mr. Fox,” which was pretty wonderful too. This one follows its own goofy rules, fills the screen with astonishing images, tells a touching tale of outcast dogs and a faithful boy, and does so with ultralively deadpan wit. My only...
